cyclone.name: BONNIE
cyclone.current_location: about 355 miles SE of Charleston, South Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: Moving west-northwest toward the South Carolina coast, then forecast to turn north and northeast along the North Carolina coast and offshore of southeastern Virginia
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: South Carolina coast between Savannah River and Little River Inlet (near Charleston area)

weather_observation.warning_coast: Savannah River to Little River Inlet, South Carolina
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southeast U.S. coast from Georgia and South Carolina northward through North Carolina into southeastern Virginia
weather_observation.wind: Possible brief tropical-storm-force gusts (30–40 mph) Monday night into Tuesday if the system tracks close to the coast
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge near 1 ft possible in lower Chesapeake Bay; surge above 3 ft not expected
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–3 inches of rain possible late Monday through Tuesday
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf and dangerous rip currents along Virginia Beach and the lower Chesapeake entrance
